#Fisher simulation example
This table is small in dimension and size of values, doesn't need a simulation. We still do the simulation on GPU just for demonstration and test.
See more tests on real data examples on section 4 of paper "Ruoyong Xu, Patrick Brown, Pierre Lâ€™Ecuyer (2021). A tool set for random number generation on GPUs in R."
```{r  teaTasting, eval=F}
TeaTasting <-matrix(c(3, 1, 1, 3),nrow=2)
TeaTasting

## Using the R function 
fisher.test(TeaTasting)$p.value
## 0.4857143


## Using GPU
TeaTasting<-vclMatrix(TeaTasting,type="integer")
streams <-  gpuR::vclMatrix(clrng::createStreamsCpu(n=64*16))
result<-clrng::fisher.sim(TeaTasting, N=100000L, streams=streams, returnStatistics=TRUE, type="double", Nglobal=c(16,64))
result$counts
result$p.value
result$threshold
result$simNum
result$streams
result$sim
as.vector(result$sim)[10:20]
length(result$sim)
```
